name: Real-World Code Scenarios
description: Tests common real-world coding patterns and mistakes

test_cases.name: Bug - Infinite Loop Missing Break
Bug - Off-by-One Error
test_cases.code:
def get_last_five(lst):
    return lst[-6:]  # Should be lst[-5:]

test_cases.name: Bug - Mutable Default Argument
test_cases.prompt: Append to list with default empty list

test_cases.name: Bug - Missing Return Statement
Bug - Type Comparison Error
test_cases.code:
def is_numeric(value):
    return value == int  # Should be isinstance(value, int)

test_cases.name: Bug - String Concatenation with None
test_cases.code:
def greet_user(name):
    return "Hello " + name  # No None check

test_cases.name: Bug - Using = Instead of ==
Bug - Accessing Non-existent Dict Key
test_cases.code:
def get_age(user):
    return user['age']  # No key existence check

test_cases.name: Clean - List Comprehension with Condition
test_cases.code:
def get_positive(numbers):
    return [n for n in numbers if n > 0]

test_cases.name: Clean - Dictionary Comprehension
test_cases.code:
def square_values(d):
    return {k: v**2 for k, v in d.items()}

test_cases.name: Clean - Multiple Return Paths
test_cases.prompt: Classify number as positive, negative, or zero

test_cases.name: Clean - Nested Functions
Clean - Set Operations
test_cases.prompt: Find unique elements in two lists
test_cases.code:
def unique_in_both(list1, list2):
    return list(set(list1) & set(list2))

test_cases.name: Clean - String Formatting
test_cases.code:
def format_person(name, age):
    return f"{name} is {age} years old"

test_cases.name: Clean - Zip Function
test_cases.code:
def combine_lists(list1, list2):
    return list(zip(list1, list2))
